item.title: Meta AI release Llama 3.3
item.description:
Meta AI release Llama 3.3 This new Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct model from Meta AI makes some bold claims:
This model delivers similar performance to Llama 3.1 405B with cost effective inference thatâ€™s feasible to run locally on common developer workstations.
I have 64GB of RAM in my M2 MacBook Pro, so I'm looking forward to trying a slightly quantized GGUF of this model to see if I can run it

item.title: New Gemini model: gemini-exp-1206
item.description:
New Gemini model: gemini-exp-1206 Google's Jeff Dean:
Todayâ€™s the one year anniversary of our first Gemini model releases! And itâ€™s never looked better. Check out our newest release, Gemini-exp-1206, in Google AI Studio and the Gemini API!
I upgraded my llm-gemini plugin to support the new model and released it as version 0.6 - you can install or upgrade it like this: llm install -U

item.title: DSQL Vignette: Reads and Compute
item.description:
DSQL Vignette: Reads and Compute Marc Brooker is one of the engineers behind AWS's new Aurora DSQL horizontally scalable database. Here he shares all sorts of interesting details about how it works under the hood. The system is built around the principle of separating storage from compute: storage uses S3, while compute runs in Firecracker:
Each transaction inside DSQL runs in a customized

item.description:
Roaming RAG â€“ make the model find the answers Neat new RAG technique (with a snappy name) from John Berryman:

item.title: New Pleias 1.0 LLMs trained exclusively on openly licensed data
item.description:
New Pleias 1.0 LLMs trained exclusively on openly licensed data I wrote about the Common Corpus public domain dataset back in March. Now Pleias, the team behind Common Corpus, have released the first family of models that are:
[...] trained exclusively on open data, meaning data that are either non-copyrighted or are published under a permissible license.

item.title: LLM 0.19
item.description: LLM 0.19 I just released version 0.19 of LLM, my Python library and CLI utility for working with Large Language Models. I released 0.18 a couple of weeks ago adding support for calling models from Python asyncio code. 0.19 improves on that, and also adds a new mechanism for models to report their token usage. item.title: Turning Your Root URL Into a DuckDB Remote Database
item.description: Turning Your Root URL Into a DuckDB Remote Database Fun idea from Drew Breunig: DuckDB supports attaching existing databases that are accessible over HTTP using their URL. item.title: Celebrating Ten Years of OpenID Connect at Identiverse and EIC
item.description: We held the second and third of the three planned tenth anniversary celebrations for the completion of OpenID Connect at the 2024 Identiverse conference and European Identity and Cloud Conference. That concludes celebrations in Asia, the Americas, and Europe! At both Identiverse and EIC, panelists included Nat Sakimura, John Bradley, and myself. Chuck Mortimore joined [â€¦]
